title: What insiders are predicting for the Red Sox in free agency this offseason
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Red Sox have roughly $219 million committed in payroll, placing them near luxury tax limits.
Insiders predict Red Sox likely to pursue top free agents like Alex Bregman and Kyle Schwarber.
Boston is among top contenders for Munetaka Murakami, with significant interest in Dylan Cease and Framber Valdez.

title: Review & setlist: John Legend was a legendary pro at MGM Fenway (and he knew it)
author: Marc Hirsh
bullets: John Legend performed at MGM Music Hall at Fenway on November 7, 2025, marking 20 years since his debut album.
Legend's setlist included hits from his debut album 'Get Lifted', as well as covers of songs by Kanye West and Alicia Keys.
The concert showcased Legend's ability to blend genres, featuring elements of gospel, R&B, and soul music.

title: Jaylen Brown seemingly criticizes officiating again following Celtics’ loss to Magic
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jaylen Brown criticized officiating after Celtics' 123-110 loss to Magic, following earlier comments after Jazz loss.
Brown mentioned feeling fouled by Magic players but refrained from further comments to avoid potential league fines.
NBA acknowledged missed foul call in Celtics' Jazz game, but Brown was not fined for postgame officiating criticism.

title: 5 things to know about Buccaneers ahead of Sunday’s game vs. Patriots
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The New England Patriots face the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, both division leaders, this Sunday in Tampa Bay.
Baker Mayfield, with 1,919 yards and 13 touchdowns, remains key for the Buccaneers despite recent setbacks.
The Buccaneers' defense, ranked seventh in DVOA, features standout performances from players like Jamel Dean and Antoine Winfield Jr.

title: Patriots’ return to relevance includes appearance by Jim Nantz in TV booth to call game for CBS
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Jim Nantz and Tony Romo will call the Patriots-Buccaneers game on CBS, marking their first Patriots game in over two years.
The return of Nantz and Romo underscores the Patriots' renewed relevance, now led by quarterback Drake Maye and coach Mike Vrabel.
Nantz has a personal connection to Drake Maye, having known him for years through their mutual sports agent, Alan Zucker.

title: Magic pull away, beat Celtics despite another big Jaylen Brown game: 8 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: The Boston Celtics lost to the Orlando Magic 123-110, marking their first defeat in the NBA Cup.
Jaylen Brown led the Celtics with 32 points on 15-for-28 shooting, but struggled from three, hitting just 1-for-6.
Magic outperformed Celtics in three-point shooting, going 17-for-36, while the Celtics' centers and defense faltered.

title: Public reprimand recommended for judge accused of helping immigrant escape ICE
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Judge Shelley Joseph recommended for public reprimand for creating an appearance of impropriety in 2018 ICE incident.
Massachusetts Commission on Judicial Conduct finds judge unaware of escape plan, recommends reprimand for judicial conduct violation.
Federal charges against Joseph were dropped in 2022; reprimand intended to address public understanding of the case.

title: Alex Cora still high on Red Sox’ future a month after being eliminated by Yankees
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Red Sox manager Alex Cora remains optimistic about the team's future despite being eliminated by the Yankees in the playoffs.
Shortstop Trevor Story opted into his Red Sox contract, while third baseman Alex Bregman opted out amid offseason changes.
The Red Sox ended the season third in the division with an 89-73 record and are focusing on building toward a successful 2026.

title: Giant blade breaks off Mass. wind turbine
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: A 75-100 foot blade detached from a 300-foot wind turbine in Plymouth, Massachusetts, and landed in a cranberry bog.
No injuries were reported, and the turbine activated a fail-safe mode to shut down immediately after the blade detached.
Police and fire officials secured the area, and the maintenance company inspected the turbine; an investigation is ongoing.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: 'The Fantastic Four: First Steps' is streaming on Disney+, offering a fresh take on the superhero team.
'Frankenstein' by Guillermo del Toro reimagines the classic story and is now available on Netflix.
'Materialists' on HBO Max features Dakota Johnson in a romantic comedy exploring modern love and companionship.
